page.title: 17AMENITIES IN BRIDGE END
page.content: MANY FACILITIES IN BRIDGE END HAVE DISAPPEARED IN THE LAST 10 OR 20 YEARS.AT ONE TIME THERE WERE 4 SHOPS AND NOW THERE IS ONLY ONE.THE POST OFFICE HAS BEEN CLOSED AS WELL AS THE SCHOOL AND BRANCH LIBRARY.MUCH OF THIS HAS BEEN A RESULT OF THE BRIDGES LINKING BURRA TO THE MAINLAND.THE SCHOOL WAS CLOSED WHEN THE LAST TEACHER RETIRED AND THE CHILDREN WERE MOVED TO HAMNAVOE.THERE WERE 18 CHILDREN AT THE SCHOOL THEN AND NOW THERE ARE OVER 40 WHO TRAVEL DAILY TO HAMNAVOE. WITH AN INCREASE IN POPULATION, THERE HAS BEEN AN INCREASE IN HOUSING, A SMALL COUNCIL ESTATE WITH SHELTERED HOUSING AS PART OF IT AND A NUMBER OF PRIVATE HOUSES. OTHER NEW FACILITIES ARE A PLAYPARK AND A BUS SHELTER AS WELL AS AN EXTENSION TO THE HALL. THE SCHOOL IS NOW AN OUTDOOR CENTRE.
